title: Cases pending in courts cross 5-crore mark: Govt in Rajya Sabha
selftext:
70,000 cases in Supreme Court. Justice delayed is justice denied.

Go to any court and a huge majority just keeps getting date after date. People with money use the courts and probably bribes from top to bottom to delay their cases for the most trivial reasons. There is huge corruption in courts.

And then talk about the quality of hearings and how the judges deliver justice. Unless one can afford a Rs. 1 Crore per hearing lawyer in Supreme Court, one cannot even claim to have faith in the justice system.
comments:
On average, each Supreme Court Judge has 2000 cases pending (max 34 Supreme Court judges and 70,000 pending cases).

Assuming no new cases, each Judge will take 5 years and 6 months to clear their plate.

Now most cases there are more than one judge involved in hearings. So assume 2 judges per case, we get 11 years to just clear the current load.

This is a never ending cycle
